content: Mercy on Jacob
For the  will have mercy on Jacob, and will still choose Israel, and settle them in their own land. The strangers will be joined with them, and they will cling to the house of Jacob.

Then people will take them and bring them to their place, and the house of Israel will possess them for servants and maids in the land of the ; they will take them captive whose captives they were, and rule over their oppressors.
Fall of the King of Babylon
It shall come to pass in the day the  gives you rest from your sorrow, and from your fear and the hard bondage in which you were made to serve,
that you will take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say:
The Fall of Lucifer
“How you are fallen from heaven,
O Lucifer, son of the morning!
you are cut down to the ground,
You who weakened the nations!
For you have said in your heart:
‘I will ascend into heaven,
I will exalt my throne above the stars of God;
I will also sit on the mount of the congregation
On the farthest sides of the north;
I will ascend above the heights of the clouds,
I will be like the Most High.’
Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol,
To the lowest depths of the Pit.
Babylon Destroyed
“For I will rise up against them,” says the  of hosts,
“And cut off from Babylon the name and remnant,
And offspring and posterity,” says the .
“I will also make it a possession for the porcupine,
And marshes of muddy water;
I will sweep it with the broom of destruction,” says the  of hosts.
Assyria Destroyed
The  of hosts has sworn, saying,
“Surely, as I have thought, so it shall come to pass,
And as I have purposed,  it shall stand:
That I will break the Assyrian in My land,
And on My mountains tread him underfoot.
Then his yoke shall be removed from them,
And his burden removed from their shoulders.
This  the purpose that is purposed against the whole earth,
And this  the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.
For the  of hosts has purposed,
And who will annul
His hand  stretched out,
And who will turn it back?”
Philistia Destroyed
This is the burden which came in the year that King Ahaz died.
